Item 7
September 2k, 19^7
Dr. Burton Paulu
President, NAEB
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Dear Burton:
The Operations and Development Committee met twice in conjunction
with the recent ETV Station Managers Seminar at Allerton House. A
quorum was present and, since Harry Skornia had to leave the Seminar,
Harold Hill attended the meetings representing Headquarters.
The results of the meetings are described in the enclosed which
was sent to the complete committee membership for comment and cor¬
rection. In addition, in order to insure accuracy, a copy was for¬
warded to John Schwarwalder• Replies have been received from him
and all but one of the committee members as of this date.
As a consequence, this committee chairman is forwarding the en¬
closed (with minor suggestions from the committee included) for Board
action. As you will note, there are three items of action recommended,
each of importance and significance to the Association.
Since each will need serious discussion by the Board, possibly
you will want the enclosed duplicated for distribution to the Board
prior to the St. Louis meeting, I will bring along to the Board
meeting the committee members* replies containing their comments con¬
cerning the enclosed.
The committee recommendation that the Television Operations and
Development Committee be dissolved by the Board and that new committees
be named is of extreme importance to the entire Association. With the
rapid growth of ETV throughout the country, there is a consensus of
the committee and indeed of the Allerton Seminar group that NAEB needs
to take a serious look at itself as regards its relationships to the
ETV members,
I look forward to the Board meeting and to discussing the en¬
closed, This third recommendation could possibly be the most impor¬
tant order of business to come out of St. Louis.
Sincerely,
/s/ JM
Jack McBride
Secretary
J:b
cc: Harry Skornia, Harold Hill and the Operations and Development
Committee
